0.title: Govt announces rent-free accommodation for 6 months for retired CJIs
0.article_body: The central government on Tuesday notified changes to the Supreme Court Judges Rules, 1959. Chief Justices of India will now get rent-free Type-VIl accommodation in Delhi for six months after demitting office. Further, apex court judges will get round-the-clock security and will also be entitled to a chauffer and a secretarial assistant for one year upon superannuation.

1.title: Shows courage, bravery: Root on Stokes opening up about mental health struggles
1.article_body: England batter Joe Root lauded Ben Stokes for openly speaking about his mental health struggles, saying it shows "great courage and bravery". He added, "We were all there with him going through it. It's not easy to see a close friend and teammate like that, but look at him now." Stokes took an indefinite break from cricket last summer.

2.title: Goa joins 'Save Soil' campaign, signs MoU with Isha Outreach
2.article_body: Joining the 'Save Soil' campaign, the Goa government on Tuesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Sadhguru's Isha Outreach. Union Minister of State for Tourism Shripad Naik was also present at the event. "Goa's economy is dependent on soil, whether it is agriculture, mining or tourism. It's our duty to conserve...ecology and environment," Goa CM Pramod Sawant said.

3.title: Same-sex marriage plea hearings shouldn't be telecast: Govt
3.article_body: The Central government has opposed the live streaming of hearing on petitions in the Delhi High Court related to the recognition and registration of same-sex marriages. Stating that there is a possibility of the live stream being edited or morphed, the government said the sanctity of the proceedings could be lost. The petitions have been listed for hearing on Wednesday.

4.title: BSF hands over 2 rescued Bangladeshi fishermen to BGB
4.article_body: The Border Security Force handed over two rescued Bangladeshi fishermen to Border Guard Bangladesh on Tuesday. The fishermen duo, Md Hanif Maula and Md Salim Holder, were rescued by Indian fishermen after their boats capsized due to inclement weather in the Haribhanga river. They were handed over to BGB as a gesture of goodwill and humanity, BSF said.

5.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan gets court summon in contempt case
5.article_body: A Pakistani court on Tuesday summoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan to appear before it next week in connection with contempt charges against him. Khan is alleged to have verbally threatened a judge during a rally over the weekend. If convicted, Khan will be barred from running for public office for life, as per Pakistani law.

6.title: Delhi sees jump in daily COVID-19 caseload with 959 new cases
6.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 959 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 6.14%, according to data shared by the health department. The city also recorded nine deaths due to the infection. The national capital witnessed a jump in its daily caseload as 625 fresh cases had been logged on the previous day.

7.title: UP CM orders property confiscation of those involved in drug trade
7.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered officials to confiscate properties and put up posters in public places of individuals involved in illicit liquor and drug trade. Following the order, the state government has set up an 'Anti Narcotics Task Force' with powers to search, seize, arrest and investigate. CM Adityanath said involvement in such trade should be a national crime.

8.title: Musk tweets meme as whistleblower claims Twitter lied about spam accounts
8.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted a meme on Tuesday after Twitter's former head of security, Peiter Zatko, claimed the social media platform lied about the number of spam accounts. "Give a little whistle," the meme shared by the Tesla CEO said. Notably, Musk is seeking to pull out of the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter over spam accounts.

9.title: ‘Unstoppable With NBK 2’ to launch during Dussehra: Reports
9.article_body: Nandamuri Balakrishna will be returning on screens with the sequel of his chat show, 'Unstoppable With NBK 2'. The OTT show will reportedly go live during Dussehra 2022. As per reports, the makers have planned a special launch before the first episode goes live. The makers have also promised that the show will host an interesting lineup of celebrities.

10.title: Farmers should adopt organic farming: Haryana Guv Dattatreya
10.article_body: Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya on Tuesday said farmers should adopt organic farming by taking advantage of the agricultural welfare policies and programmes. Interacting with a delegation of farmers in Telangana, he said, "This'll benefit and help them in becoming self-reliant." Under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, many schemes are being run to promote organic farming in the country, he said.

11.title: UP ex-village head beats Dalit schoolgirl for not wearing uniform
11.article_body: A former village head of UP's Bhadohi allegedly beat a Class 8 Dalit girl and hurled casteist insults because she was not wearing her school uniform. The accused was angered after the girl replied to him that she would wear her uniform when her father buys it for her. The accused was visiting the girl's school during the incident.

12.title: Doja Cat announces her clothing line 'It's Giving'
12.article_body: Singer Doja Cat has announced the launch of her clothing brand, titled It's Giving. The 'Say So' singer on Sunday took to her Instagram account and shared a series of photos in which she modelled a couple of pieces from the apparel line. The collection, which includes t-shirts, shorts, tracksuits and more, is currently available for pre-order.

13.title: Presenter apologises after Man Utd manager swears on camera, says 'Little f-bomb dropped'
13.article_body: Sky Sports presenter David Jones issued an apology on live TV after Manchester United manager Erik Ten Hag swore on the camera after his team defeated Liverpool. "They can f*****g play good football!" Erik said about his players. While apologising, Jones stated, "Sorry...for the language if there was...little f-bomb dropped in there we do apologise." Erik also apologised for it.

14.title: Doesn't make me feel good: Harry Styles on hate against Olivia Wilde
14.article_body: Singer Harry Styles said the hate against Olivia Wilde doesn't make him feel good. Calling it a "difficult feeling", the singer, who is dating Wilde, said he "didn't want to get into it" if he was going to hurt people. Wilde said she doesn't think the hate defines Styles' fanbase. She called the majority of them "true champions of kindness".

15.title: Pakistan to provide troops to Qatar for security during FIFA World Cup
15.article_body: Pakistan's Cabinet on Tuesday approved a draft agreement to provide troops for security at the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. The approval came just ahead of PM Shehbaz Sharif's visit to Qatar. Earlier, both Turkey and NATO had pledged troops to Qatar for the World Cup, with Ankara even training Qatari security personnel ahead of the competition.

16.title: I supported Nupur Sharma: Raj Thackeray on Prophet remarks row
16.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday defended suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over the remarks she made against Prophet Muhammad. Thackeray claimed Islamic preacher Zakir Naik had earlier made similar comments. "Everybody asked Nupur Sharma to apologise. I supported her...Nobody asked for an apology from him (Zakir Naik)," he said.

17.title: Record number of migrants crossed English Channel to enter UK on Monday
17.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry has registered a new daily record of migrants crossing over to Britain from France. As per ministry data, 1,295 people were found to have crossed the channel into the UK on August 22, beating the previous 24-hour period record set on November 11, 2021, of 1,185 people. This year 22,670 people have crossed the channel.

18.title: Gemma Owen signs six-figure deal with PrettyLittleThing
18.article_body: Model Gemma Owen has signed a six-figure deal with the fashion brand, PrettyLittleThing (PLT). Owen, who called it a "dream come true" partnership, has become the first 'Love Island' star to sign the deal after Molly-Mae Hague. "I'm excited to get to work and start designing some collections for you all," she said. Owen was reportedly "handpicked" for the deal.

19.title: Engine cover of US flight carrying 182 people flies off, passenger shares video
19.article_body: An Alaska Airlines flight had to turn around shortly after departure and make an emergency landing as an engine's cover detached. A passenger recorded a video of the engine cover of the Seattle to San Diego flight flying off as the plane is seen landing. The flight carrying 176 passengers and six crew members, however, landed safely.

20.title: Tamannaah to star in 'Lust Stories 2' with Vijay Varma: Reports
20.article_body: Director Sujoy Ghosh has reportedly roped in actress Tamannaah Bhatia to play the lead of his short film in 'Lust Stories 2'. As per reports, Tamannaah will start shooting for the film next month and she will be joined by Vijay Varma. 'Lust Stories 2' will reportedly also feature short films by R Balki, Amit Ravindernath Sharma and Konkona Sensharma.

21.title: Yash Chopra asked me to work on TV before films, gave SRK's example: Gurmeet
21.article_body: Actor Gurmeet Choudhary revealed that it was filmmaker Yash Chopra who suggested he should take up TV projects before venturing into films. "He'd said, 'If you want to become...film actor, then do TV. Become such a big star in television...that producers and directors would cast you in films, how it'd happened with Shah Rukh.' He gave...Shah Rukh's example," Gurmeet added.

22.title: Holiday in all schools in Jalore district on Wed amid heavy rainfall
22.article_body: Jalore district administration in Rajasthan has declared a holiday in all schools of the district on Wednesday due to heavy rainfall. As per a circular issued by the District Collector, the holiday is applicable only to students, not the teaching staff. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted isolated heavy rainfall and thunderstorms over south-west Rajasthan for Wednesday.

23.title: Sanctioned nearly 5,000 Russians since Ukraine war began: US
23.article_body: The US sanctioned nearly 5,000 Russians, including top leaders, after Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24, said a State Department spokesperson. "We have worked with allies and partners to impose costs, including visa restrictions for Kremlin officials," the official said. The US has warned the Russian Ambassador to the US about the escalation of violence, the spokesperson added.

24.title: Was shocked to see Kohli’s intensity towards training in RCB: Mandeep
24.article_body: Recalling his playing days with Royal Challengers Bangalore, Mandeep Singh, who now represents Delhi Capitals, said, "When I joined RCB, I was shocked to see Virat Kohli's intensity towards training." He added, "His fitness has been instrumental in making him a consistent performer in T20 cricket. It has helped the bowlers improve and has helped Test cricket overall."

25.title: 15-yr-old dies after falling into river while clicking selfie in U'khand
25.article_body: A 15-year-old boy, Manish Uniyal, died in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Tuesday after falling into Bhagirathi river while taking a selfie with his mobile phone, police said. The teenager was alive when he was pulled out of the river by State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) divers, police said, adding he was declared dead by doctors at the hospital.

26.title: Twitter whistleblower claims company lied about spam accounts, CEO Parag responds
26.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded after former head of security, Peiter 'Mudge' Zatko, accused the platform of lying about the number of spam accounts. The claims are a "false narrative that is riddled with inconsistencies and inaccuracies, and presented without important context", Agrawal said. Zatko was fired for "ineffective leadership and poor performance" earlier this year, he added.

27.title: Ronaldo can still fit into Manchester United's system: Ten Hag
27.article_body: Manchester United's manager Erik ten Hag said that forward Cristiano Ronaldo can still fit in the team's plan. "I think he can...In his whole career, [he played] under several managers, he did in several styles and systems," Hag said. He added, "For me, his [Ronaldo] age is not an issue. If you...still deliver the performance, you are also good enough."

28.title: Army chief General Pande to visit Nepal in September
28.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande will be embarking on a five-day Nepal visit on September 4. He will hold talks with Nepalese Army chief General Prabhuram Sharma on key issues regarding military cooperation between India and Nepal, official sources said, PTI reported. The visit will be aimed at exploring ways to boost overall strategic ties between the two countries.

29.title: Australia to stop prime ministers from gaining secret powers
29.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese on Tuesday said the government will launch an inquiry to prevent a Prime Minister from ever again amassing new ministerial powers in secret. Former PM Scott Morrison had secretly taken charge of five ministerial roles from March 2020 to May 2021. After the revelation, Solicitor-General Stephen Donaghue said Morrison was "validly appointed" in duplicated portfolios.

30.title: A lot of hate sometimes is entertaining: Johar on 'Koffee...' reactions
30.article_body: Karan Johar opened up about the reactions he gets for his talk show, 'Koffee with Karan', and said the only feedback he takes is "figuring out how to keep it tight, not let...conversation meander too much". He added, "A lot of the hate sometimes is entertaining because I wonder why they are cursing it so much, but also watching it?"

31.title: Ponting, Pant have made DC an extremely professional franchise: Mandeep
31.article_body: Speaking about his IPL franchise Delhi Capitals, batter Mandeep Singh said head coach Ricky Ponting and captain Rishabh Pant have made DC an extremely professional franchise. "Ponting loves discipline and commitments and treats everyone equally," he added. Mandeep has also played for Kolkata Knight Riders, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Punjab Kings. Mandeep played three matches in IPL 2022.

32.title: Ronaldo ignores ex-Liverpool defender Carragher on camera, greets ex-teammates
32.article_body: Before the match against Liverpool, Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo decided to meet and greet his former teammates-turned-TV pundits Roy Keane and Gary Neville while they were on camera. Former Liverpool player Jamie Carragher who was standing between the two though was ignored by Ronaldo. "He totally blanked me," Carragher later said.

33.title: Kenyan group sues UK govt over colonial-era land grab
33.article_body: A group of Kenyans filed a case against the UK government in the European Court of Human Rights on Tuesday. The petitioners are seeking investigation into cases of land theft and atrocities they say were committed in Kenya's Kericho region during British rule. Many in Kericho continue to suffer due to the theft of their land, the UN has said.

34.title: Will not resign despite no-trust vote: Bihar Assembly Speaker
34.article_body: The Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha said that despite a no-confidence motion moved against him by 55 MLAs of the ruling 'Mahagathbandhan', he will not resign. Claiming that the no-trust vote was based on false charges, he said that resigning will hurt his self-respect. The no-confidence motion was brought without taking care of legislative rules, he added.

35.title: Retired Andhra teacher cheated of ₹21 lakh via WhatsApp message
35.article_body: A retired teacher from Andhra Pradesh lost around ₹21 lakh from her bank account after receiving a WhatsApp message from an unknown number with a link attached to it. The victim said once she clicked on the link, several bank transactions of money withdrawals were made by alleged cybercriminals, who allegedly hacked into her phone.

36.title: Assam students protest against DC for allegedly slapping professor
36.article_body: Hundreds of students on Tuesday held a protest in Assam's Silchar against Deputy Commissioner (DC) of Cachar district, Rohan Kumar Jha. Students of Cachar College claimed that the DC had slapped and verbally abused a professor during the state government's recruitment examination on Sunday. Protesters have threatened to block the next phase of the examination if Jha refuses to apologise.

37.title: Shane Watson names his 5 players for World T20I XI
37.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has named the first five players he would choose to play for a World T20I XI in Australia. He included Pakistan's Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi, India's Suryakumar Yadav, Australia's David Warner and England's Jos Buttler. Talking about Suryakumar, Watson said, "He's batting incredibly well."

38.title: Don't call it COVID, it's just flu; Dravid will be back after taking paracetamols: Shastri
38.article_body: After Rahul Dravid tested positive for COVID-19, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Today, don't call it COVID-19, it's just flu." He added, "This Covid, Covid, you don't talk about Covid now. It's just flu. Take a couple of paracetamols and he'd be back in time for India vs Pakistan." India will face Pakistan in Asia Cup on August 28.

39.title: India forced Twitter to hire a government agent: Whistleblower
39.article_body: Ex-Twitter security chief Peiter Zatko alleged the Indian government forced Twitter to put a government agent on payroll, as per a whistleblower disclosure with US regulators. Zatko said the agent would've had access to sensitive user data. "Twitter didn't...disclose to users that it was believed by...executive team that...Indian government...succeeded in placing agents on [its] payroll," he said.

40.title: TN govt issues glossary to address people from LGBTQIA+ community
40.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has issued a glossary, as suggested by the Madras High Court, explaining how persons belonging to the LGBTQIA+ community should be addressed or described. By doing so, an attempt is being made to address persons belonging to the community with more dignity and respect, the Additional Advocate General said.

41.title: For how long will PM save tainted ministers?: Priyanka on Ajay Mishra
41.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday criticised Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Kumar Mishra after his "dogs bark on the road or chase the car" remark. "[He's] making statements...degrading the farmers," Priyanka tweeted. Further, she questioned, "For how long will the Prime Minister continue to save the tainted ministers?" Mishra's son is accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence.

42.title: AAP volunteers join Delhi BJP amid rumours of rift
42.article_body: Several volunteers and office bearers of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) have joined the BJP's Delhi unit. Delhi BJP head Adesh Gupta said that the AAP volunteers quit in protest over corruption charges in the excise policy against the Kejriwal government in Delhi. The BJP and AAP have been sparring over the Delhi government's liquor policy being probed by CBI

43.title: India to see 400 mn air travellers in 7-10 yrs: Aviation Minister
43.article_body: India is expected to see 400 million air travellers annually in the next 7-10 years, double the current 200 million, said Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia. He added that he expects India's overall fleet size to almost double to 1,200 in the next 5 years. "We need wide-body aircraft in the country to become an international hub," Scindia added.

44.title: Aware of charges against Khan, want impartial legal process: UN chief
44.article_body: UN chief António Guterres has said that he's aware of terror charges against ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan and has called for "impartial legal process". Guterres' remarks come as Khan was recently booked under a terrorism case for allegedly threatening a judge and two police officials at an event. Khan has been granted pre-arrest bail till August 25 in the matter.

45.title: 'Boycott Bollywood' trend won't last long: Shefali Shah
45.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah, who was most recently seen in the film 'Darlings', has opened up on the 'boycott Bollywood' trend on social media and said, "It's a trend. I don't think it's long-lasting." When asked about the notion that Bollywood is 'dying', Shefali said, "I don't think it's possible. Films are a culture like cricket. It can't die...it can't."

46.title: Healthcare workers real heroes during COVID-19: Mansukh Mandaviya
46.article_body: Praising the work of healthcare workers during the COVID-19 pandemic, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that they were the real heroes for risking their own health and lives to save patients. Speaking at the Bharat Swaasth Mahotsav, he said that the nation will forever be indebted to them. Further, he added that "the contribution of healthcare professionals is invaluable".

47.title: Before debut, Bobby would never allow himself to get photographed: Rumy Jafry
47.article_body: Filmmaker Rumy Jafry, who penned Bobby Deol's 1997 film 'Aur Pyaar Ho Gaya', in an interview said, "[Bobby] would never allow himself to get photographed [before his debut]." "This was a time when a star used to be properly launched. Hence, he was saving himself for...big screen so that his correct photograph and visuals would be out," Rumy added.

48.title: Hope Kohli doesn't make a comeback against Pakistan at Asia Cup, jokes Akram
48.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who hasn't scored an international century since November 2019, Wasim Akram jokingly said he hopes that the India batter doesn't make a comeback against Pakistan at upcoming Asia Cup. "For the past year, I'm seeing Indian fans on social media...press having a go at Kohli...He's just 33 and...one of the best of all time," he added.

49.title: If Kohli hits a fifty against Pak, mouths will be shut for the rest of Asia Cup: Shastri
49.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has opined that if Virat Kohli hits a fifty against Pakistan in India's first match of Asia Cup 2022, mouths will be shut for the rest of the tournament. "What's happened in the past is history. Remember, public memory is very short. So it works both ways," Shastri added.

50.title: UP Olympic Association Secy's pics in compromising position with women go viral
50.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Olympic Association's General Secretary Anandeshwar Pandey's pictures in a compromising position with different women went viral on social media. After the pictures were circulated online, the Regional Sports Officer Lucknow Ajay Kumar Sethi sought a report. Sethi stated that Pandey's "illicit activities" are tarnishing the image of Uttar Pradesh.

51.title: Footprints of dinosaur from 113 million years ago spotted in US, pic surfaces
51.article_body: Previously submerged dinosaur footprints have been uncovered in US' Texas after a river dried up due to a drought. A representative of the Dinosaur Valley State Park said that the footprints belonged to an Acrocanthosaurus, a relative of the Tyrannosaurus Rex that stood 15 feet high. The tracks are believed to have been left around 113 million years ago.

52.title: It'll be as holy as Gita: Union Minister Shekhawat on book on PM Modi
52.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat during an event in Rajasthan compared a book titled 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' with the Bhagavad Gita. "This book will be as holy and important as the Gita updesh (sermons) given by Lord Krishna," said Shekhawat. Congress said the statement is an "insult to the Gita" which "hurts the sentiments of" Indians.

53.title: Process to elect next Congress Prez to conclude by September 21
53.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the process to elect the next party President began on August 20 and will conclude by September 21. "The exact date of election will be announced in a few days," he said. On Monday, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the party was 'unanimously in favour of Rahul Gandhi' being the next party President.

54.title: IAF to deploy 2 helicopters for relief operations in flood-hit MP
54.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) will deploy two helicopters to conduct relief operations in flood-hit Vidisha district in MP, officials said on Tuesday. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan was scheduled to conduct an aerial survey of the district. Large parts of the state, including Bhopal, received heavy rain in the last few days, leading to electricity supply disruptions in many places.

55.title: S Jaishankar inaugurates Indian Embassy in Paraguay
55.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has inaugurated the new Indian Embassy in Paraguay's capital Asuncion. After the inauguration, which was attended by Paraguay's Foreign Minister Julio Cesar Arriola, Jaishankar tweeted, "Confident that this new resident mission will take the India-Paraguay relations to greater heights." The embassy began operating at the beginning of this year.

56.title: BJP leader's body found hanging from tree in J&K's Kathua
56.article_body: BJP leader Som Raj was found hanging from a tree under 'mysterious circumstances' in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district, officials said. Raj had been missing for the past few days and his body had blood marks on it, added officials. The police have launched a probe into the matter, with the family alleging that Raj was murdered.

57.title: Taxi driver arrested with Siddique gets bail in Hathras UAPA case
57.article_body: The Allahabad High Court on Tuesday granted bail to Mohammad Alam, who was arrested under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) along with journalist Sidiqque Kappan. Alam was apparently the driver of the taxi which took Kappan to Hathras for meeting the Hathras gangrape victim's family in 2020. "He was just ferrying the passengers in his taxi," Alam's counsel said.

58.title: Give protection to Gotabaya & his family: SL rights body to Prez
58.article_body: Sri Lanka's top human rights body has urged President Ranil Wickremesinghe to provide protection to ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and his family as guaranteed by the Constitution to facilitate the latter's return to the country. The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka said it had received complaints stating that Rajapaksa resigned amid pressure. Gotabaya Rajapaksa is currently in Thailand.

59.title: 'Realistic' sex doll mistaken for naked corpse on Thai beach, triggers panic
59.article_body: A 'hyper-realistic' sex doll washed ashore on a beach in Thailand, triggering panic among beachgoers who called the police, mistaking it for a naked dead body. Paramedics and police reached the scene and found that the alleged corpse was actually a sex doll costing 20,000 Baht (around ₹44,000). The incident took place at a Bang Saen beach on August 18.

60.title: Debates held in Kerala Assembly over Lok Ayukta (Amendment) Bill
60.article_body: Arguments were seen in the Kerala Assembly on Tuesday over the introduction of the Kerala Lok Ayukta (Amendment) Bill, which proposes the executive be made the appellate authority over reports of the Lok Ayukta. The Congress-led UDF claimed the proposal violated the Constitutional doctrine of separation of powers. Despite the protestations, the bill was sent to the subject committee.

61.title: 'Adani unit bought 29% stake without our consent', says NDTV; issues statement
61.article_body: NDTV said that Adani Group's VCPL acquired control of RRPR Holding Private Limited (which owns 29.18% of NDTV), "without any discussion with NDTV or its founder-promoters Radhika and Pronnoy Roy". RRPR's 99.5% equity shares were acquired by VCPL "without any input from...or consent of the founders", NDTV said, adding that it was made aware of this exercise of rights today.

62.title: MP govt must ensure that farmers get adequate price for garlic: Digvijaya
62.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has said that the Madhya Pradesh government must ensure that farmers get adequate price for garlic. "In...Sehore district, the farmers...were forced to throw away hundreds of quintals of garlic in the Parvati river," Digvijaya said. He added that PM Narendra Modi's promise to double the farmers' income by 2022 has turned out to be a "jumla".

63.title: HIV/AIDS prevalence rate in Mizoram 10 times of national average
63.article_body: The prevalence rate of HIV/AIDS in Mizoram is 2.3%, 10 times higher than the national average, Mizoram State AIDS Control Society (MSACS) said on Tuesday citing a recent survey. Among states, Mizoram now has the highest percentage of population infected with HIV. The state is followed by Nagaland at the second position with 1.45% of its population being infected.

64.title: Well done: Anurag on 17-yr-old GM Praggnanandhaa's win vs world no. 1 Carlsen
64.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur praised India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa following his win against world number one Magnus Carlsen at FTX Crypto Cup in Miami. "Well done...Inspiring rise and game that resulted in the defeat of five-time world champion...Defeating Carlsen thrice in six months is a remarkable feat!" he tweeted. Praggnanandhaa finished runner-up in the event.

65.title: 'Suspicious object' found on wall of police station in Punjab
65.article_body: Police in Punjab said on Tuesday a "suspicious object", which appeared like a pocket transistor, was spotted on the wall of a police station in Ferozepur. According to officials, the anti-bomb disposal squad was immediately informed about the device, but personnel stationed at the station destroyed it using bricks. The SHO said a sand wall was erected near the area.

66.title: ED denies filing money laundering case against Sisodia after announcing move
66.article_body: A senior official of Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday denied registering any case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 case. This comes hours after ED Additional Director Sonia Narang confirmed to ANI about filing a money laundering case against Sisodia. CBI shared a copy of FIR against Sisodia with ED on Sunday.

67.title: Will restore Ukrainian rule in Crimea: Prez Zelenskyy ahead of I-Day
67.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has vowed to restore Ukrainian rule over Russia-annexed Crimea, a move he claims will be the "biggest anti-war step". Zelenskyy further said that such a step will help re-establish "world law and order". His remarks come ahead of the country's Independence Day, August 24, which also marks six months since Russia invaded Ukraine.

68.title: Canada adds 62 Russian individuals, 1 defence firm to sanctions list
68.article_body: Canada has added 62 Russian individuals and one defence sector entity to its Russian sanctions regime in response to the invasion of Ukraine, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said in a statement on Tuesday. The freshly sanctioned individuals include Russian federal governors and regional heads, and senior officials of already sanctioned defence firms, Trudeau informed.

69.title: She was like a mother figure to me: Rahul Vaidya after Sonali Phogat's death
69.article_body: Mourning the demise of Bigg Boss 14 contestant and TikTok star Sonali Phogat, singer Rahul Vaidya said, "I'm in deep shock." "She had come for my wedding, and recently when my single released on Friendship Day, she asked me to send...the song," he said, adding, "I wouldn't call her a friend, she was...like a mother figure to me, very affectionate."

70.title: A huge compliment: Archana on being compared to Nawazuddin's 'Haddi' look
70.article_body: Archana Puran Singh has reacted after being compared to Nawazuddin Siddiqui's look in his upcoming film 'Haddi'. She said it's "a huge compliment" to be compared to Nawazuddin in "any way possible". "It's the hairstyle which has become synonymous with me that's causing all these comparisons. I've used this side-parted look during the early part of Kapil show," said Archana.

71.title: Neeraj recovers from groin injury, to participate in Lausanne Diamond League
71.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Neeraj Chopra confirmed that he'll be participating in upcoming Lausanne Diamond League 2022. He had pulled out of Commonwealth Games 2022 due to a groin injury sustained in Oregon last month. "Feeling strong and ready for Friday...See you in Lausanne!" tweeted Neeraj. The javelin thrower won India's first-ever silver medal at World Athletics Championships in July.

72.title: Disney appoints ex-Google employee Sajith Sivanandan as head of Hotstar
72.article_body: Disney International has appointed Sajith Sivanandan as Executive Vice President and Head of Disney+ Hotstar who was previously working with Google. Sivanandan's role will begin from October, and will report to both Rebecca Campbell, Chairman of Disney's International content and operations group and K Madhavan, President, Disney Star. His role includes overseeing Hotstar's India operations.

73.title: Akshay Kumar & Arshad Warsi to unite for 'Jolly LLB 3': Reports
73.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi will reportedly star in Subhash Kapoor's 'Jolly LLB 3'. Arshad played the titular role in the first instalment of 'Jolly LLB', while Akshay featured in 'Jolly LLB 2', which released in 2017. As per reports, the third instalment, which is based on a relevant topic, will go on floors in the first half of 2023.

74.title: Mumbai-bound IndiGo aircraft develops snag in engine at Goa airport
74.article_body: An IndiGo aircraft carrying 187 passengers, including four infants, developed a snag in its right engine while proceeding to the runway at the Goa airport on Tuesday, a senior official said. The flight was scheduled to fly to Mumbai. All the passengers were disembarked safely by the rescue teams and the aircraft was taken to the taxi bay.

75.title: Man sets self on fire near Maha Vidhan Bhavan over property issue
75.article_body: A man set himself on fire outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Mumbai due to an unresolved property dispute with his brother. Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said he has ordered a probe into the matter and that the man's father had also attempted suicide over the dispute a few months back. The man sustained 15-20% burn injuries.

76.title: Suspended Telangana BJP leader Raja Singh granted bail hours after arrest
76.article_body: Suspended Telangana BJP leader T Raja Singh was granted bail on Tuesday within hours of being arrested after a court returned his remand application. The court has ordered that Singh be released immediately. He was arrested over alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad following massive protests in Hyderabad.

77.title: ED registers money laundering case against Sisodia in Delhi Excise Policy scam
77.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday registered a money laundering case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 case. CBI shared a copy of the FIR against Sisodia and other relevant documents pertaining to the case with ED on Sunday. Sisodia alleged he was "targeted" as he holds a position in Arvind Kejriwal's cabinet.

78.title: Felicitating any accused is wrong: Fadnavis on Bilkis Bano convicts
78.article_body: Reacting to a discussion on the release of the convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that felicitating any convict is wrong. "The accused have been freed after completing nearly 20 years...But it's wrong if any accused is welcomed...There's no justification for this [act]," he said. The convicts were reportedly garlanded after their release.

79.title: Mamaearth tops Practus Hurun India PE Performers ranking
79.article_body: SharkTank host Ghazal Alagh founded Honasa Consumer (Mamaearth) has topped the Practus Hurun India PE Performers 2022 ranking, with a growth of 491% over the last year and pharmaceutical company Encube Ethicals ranked second with a growth of 343%. The report ranks the best performing private equity-backed companies. Sequoia Capital India, Norwest Venture Partners were among the top five investors.

80.title: Want to direct an action film someday: Gulshan Devaiah
80.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah said he would like to direct a film or go back to fashion if he had to make a career switch. The actor said that while he is not yet ready for direction, he would like to "direct an action film someday" without the usual tropes. "I want to approach it like a drama," he added.

81.title: Vijay has been accepting of my opinions on ‘Arjun Reddy’: Ananya
81.article_body: Ananya Panday said she didn't judge Vijay Deverakonda for his film 'Arjun Reddy'. Defending him, Ananya said, "As actors, we are not what we portray on-screen." Ananya said Vijay was "very accepting" of her opinion on the film. The actor had recently said that she wouldn't be or let her friends be in the kind of relationship the film showcases.

82.title: Policeman kills pregnant wife & flees; locals torch his house in J&K
82.article_body: A Special Police Officer (SPO) allegedly bludgeoned his pregnant wife to death in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district on Tuesday following an argument, officials said. The woman's baby died in her womb, officials added. SPO Mohan Lal, who was on leave, fled the murder scene before neighbours arrived. Officials said agitated people torched his house before police controlled the situation.

83.title: India's top order will be delighted by Shaheen's absence at Asia Cup: Styris
83.article_body: Scott Styris has said not just India but every top order will be delighted by Shaheen Shah Afridi's absence at upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "It gives them a greater chance of winning the tournament," he added. Shaheen has been ruled out due to a knee injury. Earlier, Waqar Younis said, "Shaheen's injury [is a] big relief for...Indian top order batsmen."

84.title: Hungary weather service heads fired after inaccurate rain forecast
84.article_body: The two top officials of Hungary’s meteorological service were fired on Monday after they made an inaccurate forecast, which prompted the postponement of a fireworks display on a national holiday. Fireworks in Budapest to commemorate St Stephen's Day were called off after rains were predicted, which turned out to be false. The meteorological service had also reportedly issued an apology.

85.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes hundred off 75 balls in one-day match, his 3rd ton in 11 days
85.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Tuesday smashed hundred off 75 deliveries while representing Sussex against Middlesex in the Royal London One-Day Cup 2022. Pujara went on to score 132 runs off 90 deliveries in the match. The 34-year-old has now slammed three hundreds in List A cricket in the last 11 days. He also crossed 500 runs in the ongoing tournament.

86.title: SC transfers conman Sukesh & his wife to another jail from Tihar
86.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has ordered that conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar and his wife be moved from Delhi's Tihar Jail to Mandoli Jail in the city. Chandrashekhar and his wife had filed a plea seeking a transfer to a jail outside Delhi alleging a threat to their lives. The conman is in prison on charges of money laundering and duping people.

87.title: Debate on freebies needed for welfare of India: CJI NV Ramana
87.article_body: CJI NV Ramana, while hearing a Supreme Court (SC) petition, said there was a need for a debate on 'freebies' for the welfare of India. "Suppose the Centre makes a law that states cannot give freebies. Will such a law be open for judicial scrutiny?" he asked. He said there was a need to differentiate between 'freebies' and 'welfare schemes'.

88.title: Agencies shouldn't be used in wrong way: Warring on BB Ashu's arrest
88.article_body: Punjab Congress workers along with state chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday protested against the arrest of party leader Bharat Bhushan Ashu and said agencies should not be used in the wrong way. "Ashu Ji's name wasn't even mentioned in the FIR," Warring said. "We're here at Punjab Vigilance Bureau office to ask why was he arrested," he added.

89.title: Illegal liquor factory busted in Jharkhand's Chatra, 4 arrested
89.article_body: An illegal liquor factory was busted and four inter-state smugglers were arrested in Jharkhand's Chatra on Tuesday, police said. The accused were operating the factory in a closed upgraded primary school premises, DSP Kedar Nath Ram said. Altogether 1,854 bottles of illicit liquor and liquor making materials were seized, he said, adding stickers of branded liquor companies were also seized.

90.title: 16-yr-old boy killed over love affair in UP's Barabanki, 3 held
90.article_body: Police on Tuesday said three men were arrested for allegedly killing a 16-year-old boy over a love affair in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki. Suraj Chauhan's body was found on a barb wire in a field on Monday, police added. Chauhan's uncle accused Kallu, Farid and Abid of killing him as he was in love with a girl from their family.

91.title: Mizoram Police seizes heroin worth ₹13.4 crore, 2 arrested
91.article_body: Heroin weighing 2.7 kg worth ₹13.4 crore was recovered by Mizoram Police from Kawnpui town in Kolasib district near the border with Assam, police said in a statement. Two individuals who were allegedly found possessing the contraband were arrested on Monday, police added. According to police, one of the arrested persons is a Myanmar national.

92.title: Govt school teacher suspended for molesting girls on campus in Raj
92.article_body: A government school teacher in Rajasthan's Bharatpur was suspended for allegedly molesting girls on the school campus, officials said on Tuesday. As per reports, local residents blocked roads and barricaded the area as they demanded action against the accused. "I have had a word with the girls. They confirmed the sad incident," District Education Officer Raghunath Khatik said.

93.title: PM to inaugurate ₹660 cr cancer hospital in New Chandigarh on Wed
93.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in New Chandigarh, Punjab, on Wednesday. According to the Health Ministry, the 300-bed hospital has been built by the Centre at a cost of over ₹660 crore and is equipped with modern facilities to treat all types of cancers using every available treatment modality.

94.title: US Embassy issues security alert in Ukraine, urges US citizens to leave
94.article_body: The US Embassy in Kyiv has warned of an increased possibility of Russian military strikes on Ukraine in the coming days around Ukrainian independence day and urged US citizens there to leave if they can. Earlier, Ukraine banned public celebrations in the capital on the anniversary of independence from Soviet rule on Wednesday, citing a heightened threat of attack.

95.title: South Africa, Australia firm favorites to play WTC final: Chopra
95.article_body: Former India batter Aakash Chopra has said that Australia and South Africa are currently the "firm favourites" to play the World Test Championship final in 2023. "Even if Australia win six out of their remaining nine Tests, they will end up on 68.4% (winning percentage), which is marginally ahead of India. This is a major problem," Chopra said.

96.title: 5 Chinese aircraft crossed Taiwan Strait median line, says Taipei
96.article_body: Five Chinese aircraft crossed the Taiwan Strait median line on Tuesday, the Taiwanese defence ministry said. The aircraft were among the 20 Chinese aircraft found operating in Taiwan's vicinity, the ministry informed. China has stepped up military activity around Taiwan since US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit that took place earlier this month.

97.title: His 'King' title: Deverakonda on a thing he wants to steal from SRK
97.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda in an interview was asked a thing he would want to steal from Shah Rukh Khan, to which he replied, "His King title." The actor, who'll soon be seen in 'Liger', further said he is in no hurry to sign films. "[After] Liger, I'll take some time and listen to stuff and...figure out what I want," Vijay added.

98.title: Govt sacks 3 IAF officers over accidental firing of BrahMos missile into Pakistan
98.article_body: The Centre has sacked three officers of the Indian Air Force (IAF) with immediate effect while holding them responsible for the March 2022 incident where a BrahMos missile misfired, the IAF said. The terminated officers- a Group Captain, a Wing Commander and a Squadron Leader- deviated from SOPs, IAF said. The weapon was accidentally fired into an area in Pakistan.

99.title: Ran away from home at 22, returned only when I became famous: Shehnaaz
99.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill in an interview recalled running away from her home at the age of 22 to pursue her dreams in the entertainment industry. "They'd keep calling me, but I'd put the phone numbers of my family on a blocked list," she added. Shehnaaz further said she returned home only when she became famous.

100.title: Didn't eat meat the day I visited temple: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah amid controversy
100.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka BJP's allegation that ex-CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah visited a temple after eating a non-vegetarian meal, he said he didn't eat meat on that day. "Is eating meat an issue?...I eat both meat and vegetarian food, it's my habit," he said. Siddaramaiah added, "Though there was chicken curry, I ate only bamboo shoot curry and 'akki rotti'."

101.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' becomes highest-grossing Hindi film at int'l box office in 2022
101.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has become the highest-grossing Hindi film at the international box office in 2022. With earnings of $7.5 million so far at the international box office, 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has surpassed 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' ($7.47 million), 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' ($5.88 million), and 'The Kashmir Files' ($5.7 million).

102.title: India successfully flight tests VL-SRSAM missile system
102.article_body: Indian Navy and Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully flight-tested indigenously designed and developed Vertical Launch Short Range Surface-to-Air Missile (VL-SRSAM) off Odisha's coast. "The missiles, equipped with indigenous Radio Frequency seeker, intercepted the target with high accuracy," Defence Ministry said. The launch was monitored by scientists from DRDO labs.

103.title: Bengaluru's Banashankari temple to be revamped at cost of ₹48 crore
103.article_body: Bengaluru's Sri Banashankari Amma Temple is expected to be revamped at an estimated cost of ₹48 crore. Karnataka minister Shashikala Jolle, after her visit to the temple on Monday, ordered officials to submit a detailed master plan for the overall development of the premises. A permanent roof, 'prasad' distribution counter and seats should be constructed for devotees' convenience, Jolle said.

104.title: Playing Rafael Nadal at US Open would be a nightmare: Nick Kyrgios
104.article_body: On being asked whom he would want to face at Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York ahead of US Open 2022, world number 26 Nick Kyrgios said, "I don't really want to play any of the 'Big 3', you know." He added, "Played Novak Djokovic, I don't want to see him again. Rafael Nadal would be a nightmare there."

105.title: Aadhaar verification now permitted for 8 online Delhi govt services
105.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has permitted the Delhi government's industries department to accept the Aadhaar card for eight online services. The services include conversion to freehold, the permission of mortgage, application for possession, change of constitution, extending construction time, due payment and refund requests. The Aadhaar-based authentication is voluntary.

106.title: WTC Noida gets 'Premier Accredited Member' status
106.article_body: World Trade Center (WTC), Noida on Tuesday announced it was given the 'Premier Accredited Member' status by the World Trade Centers Association (WTCA). The WTCA is a global network of over 300 mutually supportive businesses across around 100 countries. "The requirements for this program are quite rigorous...could not be more proud of our members," said WTCA Chair, Board of Directors.

107.title: Maharashtra businessman offers Vinod Kambli job with ₹1 lakh per month salary
107.article_body: A Maharashtra businessman named Sandeep Thorat has offered former cricketer Vinod Kambli a job with a salary of ₹1 lakh per month. As per reports, Kambli has been offered a job in the finance division of the Sahyadri Industry Group in Mumbai. This comes after Kambli's interview went viral, wherein he talked about how he is undergoing a financial crunch.

108.title: Woman to sue Nick Kyrgios for accusing her of having 700 drinks at Wimbledon final
108.article_body: The woman, who Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios accused of having 700 drinks during the Wimbledon final, is going to sue Kyrgios for defamation. She stated that Kyrgios defamed her by making "a reckless and entirely baseless allegation". She has instructed her solicitors to start legal proceedings against Kyrgios if he does not offer "a prompt resolution to this matter".

109.title: Time most important thing in construction, govt is not taking decisions on time: Gadkari
109.article_body: While addressing 'NATCON 2022' organised by the Association of Consulting Civil Engineers, Mumbai, Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "Time is the most important thing in construction. Time is the biggest capital." He added, "The biggest problem is [that] the government is not taking decisions on time." Gadkari was dropped from BJP's Parliamentary Board last week.

110.title: Want to remake Mahesh Babu’s 'Businessman' in Hindi: Puri Jagannadh
110.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh said he wants to remake Mahesh Babu's 'Businessman' in Hindi as he feels it will have "great potential in the Hindi belts". He said that in the early 2010s, he had the idea to turn 'Businessman' and his popular film 'Pokiri' into franchises. However, the idea never took off as Mahesh was busy with other projects.

111.title: Not afraid of CBI, I'm an honest person: Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia
111.article_body: While addressing a gathering in poll-bound Gujarat's Bhavnagar, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that he's an honest person who's not afraid of CBI. "In Delhi, [AAP has] given 2 lakh government jobs...This growing enthusiasm among people across the country [has made] CBI tighten the noose on me," he said. Sisodia's facing a CBI probe in an alleged liquor scam.

112.title: FIRs filed on complaints of JNU student, staff after clash in campus
112.article_body: Two FIRs have been registered after students and security guards clashed in Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Monday. The FIRs have been lodged on separate complaints of a student and JNU's chief security officer under Sections 323 and 34 of IPC, among others. Students involved in the clash over scholarship funds were led by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP).

113.title: We will see who will stop us: Vijay Deverakonda on #BoycottLiger trend
113.article_body: Reacting to the #BoycottLigerMovie trend on Twitter, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "We've mother's blessings, people's love, god's support, a fire inside us, we'll see who'll stop us!" He stated, "With Liger we expected a bit of drama...but we'll fight. We've put our heart into making this film. And I believe...I'm correct. I feel that there is no room for fear."

114.title: My no-kissing policy on screen is for life: Actress Jannat Zubair
114.article_body: Actress Jannat Zubair has said that she would follow the 'no-kissing policy' for life. She said her policy is also the reason why she is not focusing on OTT at all. "If it wasn't a well-thought plan, I don't think it would have made to the headlines," she said. Jannat is currently seen on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.

115.title: Pak killed their chances for WTC final by not producing good wickets: Chopra
115.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on Pakistan's chances to qualify for the World Test Championship final in 2023. "Pakistan have home series against England and New Zealand...But they killed their chances by not producing good wickets when they hosted Australia," Chopra said. He added, "If you continue to prepare such wickets then you won't win."

116.title: Man complains against Zomato for cancelling pizza order in Chandigarh, gets ₹10,000
116.article_body: Zomato has been told to pay ₹10,000 and serve a free meal to a Chandigarh customer who filed a complaint with the State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission over a cancelled pizza order. The penalty was levied since the man, who ordered pizza for his children around 10 pm, was "deprived of food at late night hours", the order said.

117.title: CWG 2022 bronze medallists Treesa-Gayatri reach World C'ships second round
117.article_body: CWG 2022 bronze medal-winning shuttlers Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand reached the second round in women's doubles at World Championships 2022 after defeating the Malaysian duo of Low Yeen Yuan and Valeree Siow 21-11, 21-13 in Tokyo on Tuesday. India's Ishaan Bhatnagar and Tanisha Crasto lost to Thailand's Supak Jomkoh and Supissara Paewsampran 14-21, 17-21 in mixed doubles second round.

118.title: B'luru man dies after motorcycle hits pothole, case filed against BBMP
118.article_body: A 44-year-old man recently fell off his motorcycle after the vehicle hit a pothole in Bengaluru near Sunkadakatte area. Supreeth, who had received head injuries, died on Monday, less than a week after the accident. His brother has filed a police report against authorities of Bengaluru civic body BBMP, charging them with failing to patch potholes and maintain the road.

119.title: 65-year-old man dies of electrocution in Thane
119.article_body: A 65-year-old man died of electrocution in the Upavan area of Thane, Maharashtra. The victim, Bhurao Narayan Chavan, was driving a truck when he noticed a two-wheeler parked in the way, an official said. Chavan got out to move the two-wheeler aside when he came in contact with a metal plate protruding from a distribution panel box, he added.

120.title: Adani to indirectly buy 29% stake in NDTV, launch open offer for another 26%
120.article_body: Adani Group's AMG Media Networks Limited (AMNL) will indirectly buy a 29.18% stake in NDTV and will launch an open offer for a further 26% stake at ₹294/share, the group said in a statement. Calling the acquisition offer "a significant milestone" for AMNL, its CEO and Editor-in-Chief Sanjay Pugalia said, "We look forward to strengthening NDTV's leadership in news delivery."

121.title: 3 petrol pump workers injured as robbers attack them with axe in Pune
121.article_body: Three employees sustained injuries after two masked men attacked them with the blunt side of an axe during an armed robbery at a petrol pump in Pune's Narhe in the early hours of Tuesday. The accused looted ₹20,400 in cash. The incident took place when the filling station was closed and some employees were sleeping in the manager's cabin.

122.title: 3 of family killed, 2 injured as car crashes into tree in UP's Budaun
122.article_body: Police said three members of a family were killed and two others were injured on Tuesday when their car crashed into a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun. The accident took place around 2 am when they were returning from Khatu Shyam temple in Budaun, police added. The deceased were identified as 28-year-old Jyoti alias Ruchi, eight-year-old Shashank and 24-year-old Priyank.

123.title: India awaits evidence from Russia over IS bomber's arrest: Officials
123.article_body: India is awaiting formal sharing of evidence from Russia on the Islamic State (IS) suicide bomber who was arrested in Russia after being accused of plotting an attack in India, government officials have reportedly said. The NIA could step in to probe the matter if Russia hands over conclusive proof, officials said. The terrorist was recruited in Turkey, Russia said.

124.title: 'Bharat Jodo' is the need of the hour: Congress' Jairam Ramesh
124.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from September 7, party MP Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said it is the need of the hour. "Inflation, GST, unemployment are breaking India. Social polarisation is being done in the name of religion, caste, language, food, clothes," Jairam Ramesh said. "In politics, Centre is overpowering," he added.

125.title: I-T Dept raids offices of real estate firm Phoenix Group in Hyd
125.article_body: Income Tax Department conducted raids on offices of real estate company Phoenix Group and the residences of its Directors in Hyderabad on Tuesday. Nearly 200 income tax officials had flown in from Mumbai to conduct raids at 20 locations over alleged tax evasion. The company's Chairman Emeritus Suresh Chukkapalli is alleged to have close relations with Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS).

126.title: Rupali highest-paid actor on 'Anupamaa', charges ₹60,000 per episode: Reports
126.article_body: Rupali Ganguly is reportedly the highest-paid actor on the show 'Anupamaa'. Ganguly, who plays the titular role, charges ₹60,000 per episode while Sudhanshu Pandey, who essays the role of Vanraj Shah, charges ₹50,000 per episode, as per reports. Actress Madalsa Sharma, who stars as Kavya, gets ₹30,000 per episode, reports further said.

127.title: 2 minor sisters consume poison after being scolded by brother in UP, die
127.article_body: Two girls died after consuming poison in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district, police said on Tuesday. The girls, aged 15 and 16 years, reportedly took the decision after being scolded by their brother. While one of them died on the way to the hospital, the other passed away during treatment on Monday evening, Bareilly Additional SP (Rural) Raj Kumar said.

128.title: Improve your service or lose licence: Pune RTO to 35 driving schools
128.article_body: The Pune Regional Transport Office (RTO) has warned at least 35 driving schools to upgrade their services or risk losing their licences. The RTO's comments came after the schools performed poorly in their evaluation tests conducted to check their infrastructure. The schools have been given until August-end to improve services, following which there will be a re-inspection, an official said.

129.title: I used to call Deepak Hooda 'coach killer' in his U-19 days: R Sridhar
129.article_body: Ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar has revealed that he used to call Deepak Hooda a "coach killer" during the all-rounder's Under-19 days. "Deepak used to come up and ask, 'Sir, let's do a power-hitting session'...[and] we used to tell him, 'No Deepak, you're not coming because you're hitting the balls into Cubbon Park...we're losing expensive white kookaburra balls'," recalled Sridhar.

130.title: I'd bracket him with the likes of Rohit, Kohli, Rahul: Harbhajan on Shubman
130.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe, Harbhajan Singh said the Indian opener is a sorted batter having a sound technique and very good shot selection. "In terms of batsmanship, I'd bracket him with the likes of Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul in...current Indian team," he added.

131.title: Most countries agree with our proposal on Iran nuclear deal: EU
131.article_body: Most countries involved in talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal with Iran agree with EU's proposal in the matter, EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Tuesday. A response by the US on the proposal is expected this week, Borrell added. He further informed that Iran has sought some adjustments in EU's "final text" submitted earlier this month.

132.title: Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife gets bail in money laundering case
132.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday granted bail to Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife Poonam Jain in a money laundering case. She was granted interim bail in the case on August 6 after the court held that she wasn't arrested during the investigation and the ED had already filed a chargesheet. Satyendar Jain's bail plea will be heard on August 27.

133.title: Jharkhand woman set on fire by man for not speaking to him
133.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was allegedly set on fire by a man for not speaking to him in Jharkhand's Dumka district. The accused, Shahrukh, has been arrested and used to pester the girl to become his friend, police said. Shahrukh, who is a construction worker, set the girl on fire by allegedly pouring petrol on her on Tuesday morning, police added.

134.title: Baltic states, Poland & Finland could ban Russian tourists: Lithuania
134.article_body: Baltic nations, Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia, along with Poland and Finland may stop Russian tourists from entering their countries if European Union does not enact a union-wide ban, Lithuania's Foreign Minister Gabrielius Landsbergis said. All these countries share a border with Russia. "Russian tourists shouldn't be in the European Union...[Russia] is undertaking genocide," Landsbergis added.

135.title: Ananya seeks blessings at Gurudwara Bangla Sahib ahead of Liger's release
135.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday, who will next be seen in 'Liger', visited Gurudwara Bangla Sahib in Delhi to seek blessings for her upcoming film. She took to Instagram to share some pictures from her visit, and wrote, "Satnam Waheguru...Waheguru ji ka Khalsa Waheguru ji ki fateh." The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 25, will also feature Vijay Deverakonda.

136.title: I'm one of Shubman's biggest fans, that's why I got his shirt: Brad Evans
136.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Brad Evans has said he's one of the biggest fans of India batter Shubman Gill and that's why he asked for the 22-year-old's shirt after their final ODI on Monday. "I just sometimes watch Shubman in awe 'this guy is so good'...I watched him in the IPL and in Australia when they won that Test series," added Evans.

137.title: India's biggest problem is picking their best 11: Zimbabwe head coach
137.article_body: Zimbabwe head coach Dave Houghton said Team India's biggest problem in international cricket is picking their best 11. "How many people do you play with?" added Houghton. "The toughest job in India will be to pick your final 15 for the World Cup because you could pick 50 and...decide to play with the 11 who're good as anybody," he stated.

138.title: No political vendetta: Punjab CM after Cong leader BB Ashu's arrest
138.article_body: After Punjab Congress Working President and former minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu was arrested on corruption charges, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said there was no political vendetta behind his arrest. "Law is doing its work," Mann said. "We promised...people that action will be taken against those who looted Punjab and this arrest is part of that," he added.

139.title: 2 college students & driver killed, 7 injured in road accident in MP
139.article_body: Two college students and their van driver died while seven others were injured after a truck hit their vehicle in Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur district on Tuesday, police said. The accident occurred on Indore-Ichhapur highway, Superintendent of Police Rahul Kumar said. While the girls and the van driver died on the spot, the injured were admitted to district hospital, he added.

140.title: My commitment will be based on our int'l schedule: Stokes on playing in IPL
140.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes has said he'll be playing the franchise cricket only after considering England's international schedule. "I've played in the IPL for four years. I've loved it every time...but as I said there's a schedule to be looked at around the window of the IPL," he added. Stokes had opted out of the IPL 2022 mega auction.

141.title: upGrad increases ESOP pool size for second time in a year
141.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad increased the pool size of its employee stock option plan (ESOP) with fresh options for the second time in the last one year. According to a regulatory filing, upGrad enlarged its ESOP pool by 3,00,000 options or 13%, to 25.25 lakh from its existing 22.25 lakh options. In November 2021, upGrad increased its ESOP pool by 28%

142.title: Logistics service provider Rivigo raises $2 mn in Series H round
142.article_body: Gurugram-based logistics service provider Rivigo has raised $2 million in its Series H funding round. The round was led by Elevation Capital and Warburg Pincus affiliate Spring Canter Investment. As per a regulatory filing, the startup issued 11,840 Series H compulsorily convertible preference shares to both Elevation Capital and Spring Canter. In December 2019, the firm raised $20 million.

143.title: 7 arrested by CBI in Bogtui Rampurhat killing case in WB's Birbhum
143.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Tuesday arrested seven persons in Bogtui Rampurhat killing case in West Bengal's Birbhum district. The accused will be produced before a court in Rampurhat on Tuesday, a CBI official said. In March, at least 10 people, including women and children, were killed after unidentified miscreants set several houses in the village on fire.

144.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
144.article_body: As per IMD, heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over north Gujarat and south Rajasthan on Tuesday. IMD added that heavy to very heavy rainfall is also likely over Odisha, Kerala and Mahe on August 23 and 24. Strong surface winds (speed reaching 20-30 kmph gusting to 40 kmph) are likely over southeast Rajasthan and west Madhya Pradesh.

145.title: Covered wall with photos of killers, Akshay was very happy: Cuttputlli maker
145.article_body: Filmmaker Ranjit M Tewari, who's directed Akshay Kumar's film 'Cuttputlli', where he plays a cop, said they covered his room with over 500 photos and newspaper cuttings of real serial killers. "His character's obsessed with the...world of serial killing," he added. "When Akshay...saw...he was very happy with the detailing," he stated, adding they put photos of killers like Ted Bundy.

146.title: BS Yediyurappa launches 'Savarkar Rath Yatra' in Mysore
146.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa launched the Savarkar Rath Yatra in Mysore with the slogan 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. He claimed that former PM Indira Gandhi had called Savarkar “the remarkable son” and had also issued stamps in his memory. “I am saddened by the controversy over Savarkar in Karnataka who was called Veer by Indira Gandhi,” Yediyurappa said.

147.title: List steps taken to rescue child beggars: Delhi HC to authorities
147.article_body: The Delhi HC has directed the Centre, city government and Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights to list steps they've taken to rescue child beggars. The court has given the authorities eight weeks to disclose measures taken by them zone-wise in the entire city. The court's remarks come in response to a public interest litigation filed on the matter.

148.title: UK denies meddling in Kenyan Presidential election
148.article_body: UK High Commissioner Jane Marriott dismissed claims that she and UK interfered in Kenya's recently-concluded Presidential election. She was reacting to allegations that she pressured the electoral commission to declare William Ruto as President-elect following the disputed poll. Some social media users also shared unverified photos of her shaking hands with Ruto and the electoral body chairperson.

149.title: Pune activists demand removal of mobile immersion tanks for Ganesh Chaturthi
149.article_body: Activists in Pune have demanded that the mobile immersion tanks used during the Ganesh Chaturthi festival be discontinued. They said that incurring expenditure on these tanks was unnecessary and "a complete waste of money". The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) had introduced mobile immersion tanks during the pandemic-induced lockdown to avoid crowding during the Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

150.title: Miss you so much, it hurts: KK's wife on his birth anniversary
150.article_body: Late singer KK's wife Jyothy Krishna and his daughter Tamara Krishna remembered the singer on his 54th birth anniversary. Jyothy shared a throwback photo and wrote, "Miss you so much, it hurts", while Tamara shared how she missed waking up and eating birthday cake with KK. Tamara also promised KK that she is "not gonna let mom feel sad today".

151.title: India simply have to beat Aus 4-0 when they host them in 2023: Aakash
151.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra said India "simply" have to beat Australia 4-0 when they host the latter in 2023, in order to reach the final of the ongoing edition of the World Test Championship (WTC). "If India win 4-0, they will rise in the standings. They will need to rise otherwise they will find themselves in a precarious situation," added Aakash.

152.title: KCR worried seeing support BJP is getting: Nadda after BJP T'gana chief detained
152.article_body: Soon after Telangana Police detained BJP state chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar in Jangaon, BJP National President JP Nadda said CM K Chandrashekar Rao is worried seeing the massive support that BJP is receiving from all corners of the state against his "corrupt and family-centric regime". "I strongly condemn the illegal arrest of…Bandi Sanjay by the TRS government," Nadda added.

153.title: B'luru woman kills 4-yr-old daughter, attempts to kill self but survives
153.article_body: A woman killed her four-year-old daughter in Bengaluru. She later attempted to kill herself too. However, she survived after her husband took her to the hospital. Police recovered a suicide note in which the woman said that she was unable to handle even trivial issues and she had developed suicidal thoughts.

154.title: Video of woman's rape posted by Italian PM candidate on Twitter, sparks criticism
154.article_body: Far-right Italian politician Giorgia Meloni, who is leading the race to be the next PM of Italy, sparked criticism after she tweeted a video of a woman being raped. Meloni shared a blurred clip of a man assaulting a 55-year-old Ukrainian woman on a pavement, saying she 'couldn't remain silent'. Twitter removed the video on Tuesday, after widespread backlash.

155.title: 15-yr-old complains of stomach ache, delivers baby later; rape case filed
155.article_body: A rape case was registered against a man in Rajasthan after a 15-year-old girl delivered a baby boy. Police said the girl complained of stomach ache, after which she was admitted to a district hospital. "Diagnosis revealed that she was pregnant," police added. In another such case, a 15-year-old girl delivered a baby girl. However, the baby did not survive.

156.title: Thousands protest across Haiti, demand PM Henry's resignation
156.article_body: Thousands of protesters in Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince and other major cities blocked roads, shut down businesses and marched through the streets on Monday, demanding PM Ariel Henry's resignation and calling for a better quality of life. Protesters were heard chanting, "If Ariel doesn't leave, we're going to die." This comes amid rising gang violence and soaring consumer prices.

157.title: Minor girl can marry on attaining puberty, stay with husband under Muslim law: HC
157.article_body: While granting protection to Muslim couple, Delhi High Court observed that as per Mohammedan Law, a minor girl who had attained the age of puberty could marry without parents' consent. It added that she also has "right to reside with her husband even when she was less than 18 years of age". The girl's parents had opposed the marriage.

158.title: Mehbooba Mufti's sister gets bailable warrant in 1989 abduction case
158.article_body: Terrorist and Disruptive Activities (Prevention) Act, 1987 (TADA) court issued a bailable warrant against Mehbooba Mufti's sister Rubaiya Sayeed in the 1989 abduction case. "Rubaiya was summoned...She was supposed to be present for cross-examination, but she did not appear," a senior CBI lawyer said. Rubaiya was abducted by Jammu Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) militants on December 8, 1989.

159.title: Congress attempts to pacify Anand Sharma ahead of Himachal polls
159.article_body: UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi asked the AICC in-charge of Himachal Pradesh, Rajeev Shukla, to pacify the situation after senior leader Anand Sharma resigned from his position as Congress' Steering Committee Chairman for the state. “It is our duty to meet Anand Sharma. We have good relations with him and he is dedicated to the party,” said Shukla after meeting Sharma.

160.title: Locals march with torches in knee-deep water over waterlogging in Raj
160.article_body: Residents of Rajasthan's Sikar on Monday carried out torch rally against the administration over the issue of waterlogging due to heavy rainfall in the Nawalgarh Road area. A video of the rally purportedly shows people marching in knee-deep water and shouting slogans against the administration. Waterlogging at Nawalgarh Road has reportedly disrupted traffic movement and affected people's lives.

161.title: K'taka govt spent ₹37 lakh on 'Modi@20' book launch event: Report
161.article_body: An RTI response revealed that Karnataka government spent ₹37 lakh to organise an event launching a book on PM Narendra Modi, a report said. 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' was launched in Bengaluru in June 2022. As per the response, ₹12,38,674 was spent on digital media management and ₹1,10,000 was spent on providing 100 Mbps internet speed for the three-hour event.

162.title: Malaysian top court upholds ex-PM's jail term in corruption case
162.article_body: Malaysia's top court on Tuesday upheld former PM Najib Razak's 2020 conviction in the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) corruption case. Razak had been found guilty of misappropriating funds worth $9.4 million from SRC International, a former subsidiary of Malaysia's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB, among other charges. The 12-year prison sentence handed to Razak in 2020 was also upheld on Tuesday.

163.title: AAP should expose BJP's attempts to topple Delhi government: NCP
163.article_body: The NCP asked AAP to "expose" BJP's attempts to topple the Delhi government. This comes after AAP leader Manish Sisodia claimed BJP offered to drop all cases against him if he joined the saffron party. "There was talk of similar offers...in Maharashtra and eventually...MVA government fell. AAP [say] they have...recording of the 'offer', why wait"? NCP spokesman Clyde Crasto said.

164.title: Rakesh Tikait is a 'second rate person': Union Minister Ajay Misra
164.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Misra Teni has called farmer leader Rakesh Tikait a "second rate person". "I know Tikait very well, he is a 'do kaudi ka aadmi' (second rate person). He fought election twice and lost the deposit," Teni said. He added, "If this kind of a man opposes anyone, it is of no value."

165.title: So close yet so far: Raza on Zimbabwe's 13-run loss in 3rd ODI vs India
165.article_body: Following Zimbabwe's 13-run loss in the third ODI against India in Harare, Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza said, "So close yet so far! It really hurts when you get this close and not cross the line." Chasing 290, Zimbabwe were bowled out for 276 in 49.3 overs. Raza scored a 95-ball 115. India whitewashed Zimbabwe 3-0 in the ODI series.

166.title: I'm disconnected from social media, toxic material there: Naga Chaitanya
166.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya has stated that he is very disconnected from social media, adding that he is a boring person online. "Around my film releases, I'm reading...conversations, reviews and reactions [more than posting]," the actor added. He further said that he doesn't attach himself too much to it because there is a lot of toxic material online.

167.title: Taiwan saw off China before, retains will to defend itself: Prez Tsai
167.article_body: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen said on Tuesday that Taiwan had warded off China's military six decades ago, adding that it has retained the resolve to defend its territory to date. She made these remarks in front of a visiting group of ex-US officials. China conducted several drills around Taiwan following US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's recent visit to the island.

168.title: RBI has set 2-yr target to bring down inflation to 4%: Governor Das
168.article_body: Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das said on Tuesday that the central bank has set a two-year timeframe to bring down inflation to 4%. "We will approach the 4% inflation target in a steady manner, without much of a growth sacrifice," Das said. There is "absolutely no room" for any complacency with regards to inflation, he further said.

169.title: Man who pushed wife in front of moving train in Maharashtra arrested
169.article_body: A man who killed his wife by pushing her in front of a moving train at the Vasai Road Railway Station in Maharashtra on Monday was arrested in Thane. After pushing his wife, the man ran away from the platform with his two children. The incident was caught on a CCTV camera installed at the platform of the station.

170.title: Gujarat BJP chief is going to be removed soon, according to sources: Kejriwal
170.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that BJP in Gujarat is "terrified" because of AAP. "According to the sources, soon, Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil is going to be removed. Is the BJP so afraid?" Kejriwal tweeted. CM Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia arrived in poll-bound Gujarat for a two-day visit on Monday.

171.title: Delhi man arrested for creating fake social media profile of woman
171.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by Delhi's Dwarka Police for allegedly creating a fake social media profile of a woman after she ignored his messages. The accused, Mahaveer Singh, used to then send obscene messages to the woman, police said. Notably, Mahaveer's brother used to reside in the same building as the complainant around eight-nine years ago, police added

172.title: UP Police raid illegal hookah bar in Greater Noida, 25 arrested
172.article_body: UP Police raided a bar at a mall in Greater Noida for allegedly serving hookah to customers without permission. "We have busted an illegal hookah bar at Lucifer restaurant and bar. Over 15 hookahs and pipes have been seized from the property. We have apprehended 25 persons," said Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

173.title: Real B'wood found in dark alleys, those who make it get into drugs: Vivek
173.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared an "inside story" on Bollywood on social media, writing, "What you see is not Bollywood. Real Bollywood is found in its dark alleys." He further wrote, "Those who find some success but not the real one get into drugs, alcohol...Some success is the most dangerous one. You are in showbiz without any income and power."

174.title: Actor Aayush Sharma announces next film, shares first look
