He also posthumously awarded Dugina the Order of Courage, praising her "dedication shown in the performance of professional duty". Russia has accused Ukrainian special services of killing Dugina.

348.title: Is his ideology that of terrorists?: Vivek after Kashyap's remark on 'The...'
348.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Anurag Kashyap saying he hasn't seen 'The Kashmir Files' as it's "not his ideology", the film's director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Does this mean his ideology is that of Islamic Terrorists Brotherhood?" "This genius filmmaker says the film which is about Hindu genocide isn't his ideology," added Vivek. "Look at the intellectual dishonesty of these people," he stated.

349.title: Imams from other states will have to inform police, register on govt portal: Assam CM
349.article_body: All imams (clerics) from outside Assam will have to report to the local police station for verification of identity, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. An online government portal will be made on which imams and madrasa teachers will have to register themselves, Sarma added. This comes after two Assam imams were arrested over alleged links with Al-Qaeda-affiliated terror outfits.

350.title: Sania pulls out of US Open due to injury, says 'It'll change some of my retirement plans'
350.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza has pulled out of US Open 2022 due to injury. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "I'll be out for a [few] weeks...This isn't ideal and it's terrible timing and it will change some of my retirement plans." Earlier this year, Sania had said that she wouldn't be playing beyond the 2022 season.

351.title: Businessman forces wife to bathe naked in public in 'ritual to conceive boy' in Maha
351.article_body: A 38-year-old businessman allegedly forced his wife to bathe naked in public under a waterfall in Maharashtra's Ratnagiri as part of a black magic ritual initiated by a self-styled godman. He allegedly told the couple it'd help them conceive a male child. Police arrested four people including the man, his father, mother and the self-styled godman after the woman's complaint.

352.title: Fan asks Afridi his views on Kohli not scoring a century in 1,000+ days, he replies
352.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked former Pakistan captain and all-rounder Shahid Afridi about his take on Virat Kohli not scoring an international century for over 1,000 days. Afridi replied, "Bare players ka mushkil waqt me hi pata chalta hai (the true spirit of big players is seen when they are facing difficult times.)"

353.title: Team India players dance on 'Kala Chashma' in dressing room to celebrate win, video viral
353.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India players, including Shikhar Dhawan, Shubman Gill and Ishan Kishan, dancing on 'Kala Chashma' in the dressing room after their ODI series victory against Zimbabwe in Harare. The video was shared by Dhawan and Gill on their Instagram handles. Commenting on the video, Yuvraj Singh jokingly wrote, "Stick to cricket lads."

354.title: Elon Musk subpoenas Twitter ex-CEO Jack Dorsey in $44 bn takeover lawsuit
354.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has subpoenaed his friend and former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey as he attempts to back out of the $44 billion acquisition deal. Dorsey is being asked for documents relating to the merger as well as information on spam accounts on Twitter. Twitter and Musk are headed for a trial over the merger in October.

355.title: Law considers women as 'weaker section' of society requiring more protection: HC
355.article_body: The Bombay High Court last week transferred a matrimonial case observing that a "lady's inconvenience needs to be given more priority because the law considers women as class belonging to weaker section of society and needs more protection". The court granted relief to a woman who had sought transfer of her matrimonial dispute from Pune to Thane.

356.title: Subsidies on EVs won't be very healthy beyond a point: Delhi Minister
356.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said it would not be "very healthy" to provide subsidies to buyers of electric vehicles beyond a point. "Subsidies are good to create demand...EVs have to be within the reach of the common person eventually," he added. Delhi government has set a target of one charging point in a radius of three kilometres, Gahlot stated.

357.title: 30-yr-old Mumbai man posts 'derogatory' content on Prophet on WhatsApp; held
357.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai's Malad for allegedly using derogatory content on Prophet Mohammed on his WhatsApp status. An FIR was registered on charges under Information Technology Act sections 295A and 67A. Reports said the accused, who is a real estate agent, was produced before a magistrate's court and has been remanded in police custody for two days.

358.title: Dad Anil doesn't see himself as grandparent, he's scared: Sonam Kapoor
358.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child, said that her father and actor Anil Kapoor does not see himself as a grandparent. "I think my dad is scared...for a long time, he didn't even see himself as a parent," she added. However, Sonam revealed that it was Anil who got emotional after she told him she was expecting.

359.title: Ford to lay off 3,000 employees in India, US & Canada to slash costs
359.article_body: Ford Motor has confirmed that it is cutting 3,000 salaried and contract jobs in India, US and Canada as the carmaker looks to slash costs. In a memo to staff, CEO Jim Farley said the company is "eliminating work, as well as reorganising and simplifying functions". He also acknowledged that Ford's cost structure "is uncompetitive versus traditional and new competitors".

360.title: Manchester United defeat Liverpool 2-1 to record their 1st win of season
360.article_body: Manchester United defeated Liverpool 2-1 in Premier League 2022-23 at Old Trafford to register their first victory of the season, after having lost to Brighton and Brentford. Jadon Sancho opened the scoring for United in the 16th minute. Marcus Rashford made it 2-0 in the 53rd minute. Mohamed Salah scored the lone goal for Liverpool in the 81st minute.

361.title: Inter-state drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, 590 kg of ganja seized
361.article_body: A Special Operation Team of the LB Nagar Zone, along with Abdullapurmet Police, arrested six people and seized 590 kg of ganja. According to the release, the prime accused got involved in the illegal transportation of ganja in 2019. The police arrested the six accused, along with eight mobile phones, cash worth ₹1,900, a car and a pickup vehicle.

362.title: Man sexually assaults 30-yr-old woman, holds her captive in Delhi
362.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a 30-year-old woman and holding her captive in Delhi, police said on Monday. The accused established a physical relationship with the victim in UP's Shahjahanpur on the pretext of marriage, said ASP (city) Sanjay Kumar, adding that the accused took her to Delhi, where she was raped and kept locked up.

363.title: Mohammad Hasnain named Shaheen Afridi's replacement for Asia Cup 2022
363.article_body: Pacer Mohammad Hasnain has been named the replacement for pacer Shaheen Afridi in Pakistan's 15-member squad for Asia Cup 2022. Shaheen was ruled out of Asia Cup after being advised a four to six weeks rest by the medical team following an injury to his right knee ligament. Hasnain is currently in UK, playing for Oval Invincibles in The Hundred.

364.title: I never asked anyone why: Chahal on not being included in India's T20 WC 2021 squad
364.article_body: Talking about being snubbed from Team India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, Yuzvendra Chahal said, "I never asked anyone why because that's not in my control." He added, "Obviously, you feel bad that you aren't a part of the World Cup, but they might have thought that someone else was better and fair enough."

365.title: Delhi logs 625 new COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths; active infections drop
365.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 625 new COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 9.27%, as per data shared by the health department. The national capital also recorded seven deaths due to the infection. The city witnessed a decline in its active caseload as the active case count dropped from 5,141 on Sunday to 4,645 on Monday, according to available data.

366.title: Man Utd preparing €94 million bid for Ajax winger Antony: Reports
366.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly readying a €94 million bid for manager Erik Ten Hag's long-term target, Ajax winger Antony. The player and the Premier League club have reportedly agreed on personal terms but Ajax are reportedly reluctant to let the forward go. Antony sat out Ajax's last match and has allegedly not been training with the team.

367.title: Road accident kills 4, injures 18 in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur
367.article_body: In the Saharanpur district of UP, a road accident killed at least four and injured 18 people after a speeding car hit a tractor trolley, the police said. The accident took place on the Muzaffarnagar-Saharanpur highway and police rushed to the spot immediately to begin rescue operations, said Deputy Superintendent of Police Ramkaran. Those injured were rushed to a hospital.

368.title: Azaan on loudspeakers doesn't violate fundamental rights of others: K'taka HC
368.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has said that azaan on loudspeakers does not violate the fundamental right of people of other faiths. Hearing a PIL, which claimed that the "contents of the azaan are hurting the believers of other religious faiths", the division bench refused to order mosques to stop playing azaan on loudspeakers. The PIL was filed by Manjunath Halawar.

369.title: Aligarh college students booked for pro-Pak slogans at Tiranga rally
369.article_body: A few college students in Aligarh have been booked on the basis of a video showing them raising pro-Pakistan slogans during a Tiranga rally. The principal and college manager have also been booked after they allegedly took no action when the matter was reported to them. The principal said he received no evidence to back up the claim.

370.title: Railway Board rejects Delhi-Varanasi bullet train feasibility report
370.article_body: The Railway Board has rejected the Delhi-Varanasi bullet train feasibility report in a review meeting that took place last week, officials said. They added that the high-speed train will be unable to run at 350 kmph due to the multiple curves on the route between Delhi and Varanasi. Another official added that the detailed project report (DPR) is awaited.

371.title: Tyson Fury hints at coming out of retirement to fight Oleksandr Usyk
371.article_body: British boxer Tyson Fury has indicated that he is ready to come out of retirement to take on heavyweight champion Oleksandr Usyk. "I'd annihilate both of them...If you want those belts back then...send me in," said Fury on Instagram about the Usyk-Anthony Joshua championship fight. Fury, who is undefeated, had announced his retirement earlier this month.

372.title: Rafael Nadal to be seeded second as Zverev withdraws from US Open
372.article_body: World number two Alexander Zverev has withdrawn from the 2022 US Open due to not recovering from his ankle injury, leaving Rafael Nadal to be seeded second in the draw. Defending champion Daniil Medvedev will keep the top spot. It is still uncertain whether Novak Djokovic will feature in the tournament. The Grand Slam will begin on August 29.

373.title: PM Modi is betraying his own assurances of legally guaranteed MSP: Yechury
373.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has criticised PM Narendra Modi for allegedly failing to provide the Minimum Support Price to the country's farmers for their produce. "[PM] Modi is betraying his own assurances of legally guaranteed MSP to all farmers & all crops when their mighty struggle forced the repeal of farm laws. This betrayal will not be allowed," Yechury tweeted.

374.title: Campus Front of India to agitate against education's 'saffronisation' in Karnataka
374.article_body: The Campus Front of India, the student wing of the Popular Front of India, has announced to launch an agitation against the alleged "saffronisation" of education. The student group announced that it will start a month-long campaign called 'Detox Education Deport Hindutva' on August 25. Notably, the campaign will be held across different colleges in Karnataka and elsewhere.

375.title: All Imams coming from outside Assam have to get registered: CM
375.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said "imams and other people coming to madrassas from outside state" have to register their names on a portal. Sarma asked people to notify the police, who would conduct verification if an unknown Imam came to a village. Sarma earlier said tech-savvy foreign terrorists were threatening to turn Assam into an 'Islamist hub'.

376.title: Malik refuses legal aid over refusal for physical court appearance
376.article_body: Jailed separatist leader Yasin Malik has refused legal aid and reiterated his stand on appearing physically for hearings in the killing of four IAF personnel in 1990. Malik is currently in Delhi's Tihar Jail and is attending hearings via video conference. He had gone on a 10-day hunger strike in July against the Centre to accept his demands.

377.title: AAP ignoring excise policy suggestions led to ₹900 crore loss: BJP
377.article_body: The BJP has claimed that AAP did not incorporate recommendations made by the committee it constituted into the new excise policy, leading to at least ₹900 crore loss. They alleged that AAP kept "changing the goalpost" every time tough questions were asked. BJP also refuted Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claims of getting charges dropped for joining the party.

378.title: Chhattisgarh govt employees on strike to demand DA hike to 34%
378.article_body: Employees of the Chhattisgarh government went on an indefinite strike on Monday demanding that the dearness allowance (DA) be increased to 34% instead of the present 28%. The employees also demanded that the HRA (house rent allowance) be increased on par with that received by central government employees. Recently, the state announced the DA increase by 6 percentage points.

379.title: It was tough watching friends play for India: Samson on being in and out of team
379.article_body: Talking about being in and out of Team India, Sanju Samson said, "To be very honest...I believe everything you go through impacts you in positive manner." He added, "It was tough watching all your friends play for the country...but I really enjoyed playing those domestic games in that period." Samson won Man of the Match award in second Zimbabwe ODI.

380.title: Creator programme Born on Instagram to be available in Kannada
380.article_body: Instagram's creator programme, Born on Instagram (BoI), will be available in Kannada from September after already being available in Malayalam, Hindi and English. To expand it's vision across India, BoI helps creators interact with other influencers and learn to monetise their brand both online and offline. The BoI programme is available on Instagram's website and is free of cost.

381.title: 23-yr-old Pune techie who's Musk's 'Twitter friend' meets the Tesla CEO, shares pic
381.article_body: Pranay Pathole, the 23-year-old Pune techie, who is billionaire Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 'Twitter friend', met Musk at Tesla's Texas factory and shared a picture. "[I have] never seen such a humble and down-to-earth person," said Pathole while sharing a picture from the meeting. "You're an inspiration to millions," Pathole added.

382.title: Gill dedicates 1st int'l ton to father, says 'He schooled me after I got out in 2nd ODI'
382.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday dedicated his first-ever international hundred to his father. After slamming a hundred against Zimbabwe in the third ODI, Shubman said, "My father has been my primary coach. I got a schooling after I got out in the second ODI, so I dedicate this to him." Shubman was dismissed for 33(34) in second ODI.

383.title: Told him not to dive, but realised he is also 'Afridi': Shahid Afridi on Shaheen's injury
383.article_body: A fan requested former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi on Twitter that he should come out of retirement as fast bowler Shaheen Afridi is out injured. Shahid replied, "I had told him that he is a fast bowler and he should not dive as he can get injured. But later I realised he is also 'Afridi'."

384.title: India has over 3,000 deep-tech startups: NASSCOM report
384.article_body: As per a new report by the National Association of Software and Services Companies (NASSCOM), India has become home to over 3,000 deep-tech startups, as of 2021. The deep-tech startups in India have grown at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 53% over the last 10 years. Comparatively at a nascent stage, they have also employed over 4,000 people.

385.title: Feels good: Rahul after India complete 3-0 ODI series whitewash vs Zimbabwe
385.article_body: Following India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe, India captain KL Rahul said it feels good, adding his side came to Harare with good ideas. "We wanted to be out in...middle and use this time. The players have been very professional, very happy with the result," he further said. India beat Zimbabwe by 13 runs in third ODI today.

386.title: Had made 3 nineties but wanted to get a century: Gill on his maiden int'l ton
386.article_body: Speaking about his maiden international ton (130) in third ODI against Zimbabwe, India opener Shubman Gill stated, "It's always special to get a hundred...had made three nineties but wanted to get a century." He added, "I was just trying to minimise my dot-ball percentage, trying to time the ball." Gill was adjudged both 'Player of the Match and Series'.

387.title: BJD welcome to join NDA, says Union Minister Ramdas Athawale
387.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (Athawale) chief Ramdas Athawale on Monday said that Odisha's ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) is welcome to join the National Democratic Alliance (NDA). He highlighted that the NDA-led Centre usually receives BJD's support in the parliament. Athawale added, "[PM] Narendra Modi can allocate more budget for the state's (Odisha) development."

388.title: He will never feel alone when he's around people who love him: Virat Kohli's manager
388.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's interview on mental health wherein he said he sometimes felt alone even in a room full of people who love him, Kohli's manager Bunty Sajdeh said, "He has experienced mental challenges at only a certain stage in his career." He added, "Virat, for one, will never feel alone when he’s around people who love and support him."

389.title: Jupiter's auroras seen in detail in new pics from world's most powerful telescope
389.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, has taken two new pictures of Jupiter, which captured its auroras and rings in detail. The pictures show Jupiter with its rings which are "a million times fainter than the planet" as well as two tiny moons, ESA said. Galaxies are also seen as "photobombing" one of the pictures.

390.title: Shilpa Shetty does yoga post-fracture in a wheelchair, shares video
390.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra, who fractured her leg during a shoot, has shared a video of her doing yoga in a wheelchair. "Even though the injury needs me to take it easy, inactivity can make you rusty," she wrote while sharing the video on her Instagram handle. "Don't let anything get in the way of your routine," Shilpa further wrote.

391.title: Number of lawyers have dwindled in Parliament: CJI Ramana
391.article_body: CJI NV Ramana has said that the Parliament was earlier dominated by legal professionals. "As a result, we got outstanding Constitution and flawless laws. Nowadays the number of lawyers has dwindled and that space is taken by others," CJI Ramana said. He added that Jagdeep Dhankhar's elevation to the Vice-President's post is a "tribute to our rich constitutional values".

392.title: SC notice to Gujarat government on Teesta Setalvad's bail plea
392.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has issued notice to the Gujarat government on a bail plea filed by activist Teesta Setalvad, who was arrested for allegedly fabricating evidence in the 2002 riots cases. The state has been asked to reply by August 25. SC said it'll also consider whether it can give bail while the Gujarat HC is hearing the case.

393.title: Explosives-laden bag found in Swedish capital destroyed by police
393.article_body: Police in Sweden's capital Stockholm disposed of an explosives-filled bag that was found in a park late on Sunday night, they said on Monday. A preliminary investigation has been initiated in the case. No one has been taken in custody so far. The park, where the bag was found, hosted Stockholm's annual cultural festival from August 17 to August 21.

394.title: Fan's 'Can I have your shirt?' banner comes on big screen, Dhawan's reaction goes viral
394.article_body: During the third Zimbabwe-India ODI in Harare, the big screen showed a fan holding a poster that read, "Shikhar...can I have your shirt?" The camera then showed Shikhar Dhawan sitting in the dressing room. On seeing the big screen, Shikhar pretended to remove his shirt, after which teammates around him were seen laughing. India won the ODI by 13 runs.

395.title: Ex-Punjab minister arrested from salon on corruption charges
395.article_body: Punjab Congress Working President and former state minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu was arrested from a hair salon in Ludhiana on corruption charges. Ashu, who was the food and supplies minister, was arrested in connection with the food grains transportation tender case. A video showed Ashu sitting on a chair in the salon, while vigilance officials arrived to arrest him.

396.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' to re-release in theatres with additional footage
396.article_body: Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is returning to the theatres with an extended version. Sony Pictures on Monday announced that the film will be re-released on September 2 and will feature "with all-new additional footage", which didn't make it in the first theatrical cut. In India, the film will release in English and Hindi.

397.title: An influential personality made fake promise of a film: Asim
397.article_body: Actor Asim Riaz said an "influential personality" made "fake promises" to his father of a film. He said for more than a year, the makers used his name to bring the film under media's limelight. "The pressure and anxiety they have given me will never make me stop doing what I am doing right now," he said.

398.title: Man rapes & kills girl, mutilates her face after she sees him with her mother in Delhi
398.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for kidnapping, raping and murdering a minor girl whose mother was in a relationship with the accused, police said. The accused committed the crime after the victim saw him in "a compromising position" with her mother, said Delhi DCP Shweta Chauhan. He also mutilated the girl's face and hid her body, Chauhan said.

399.title: Tiger's 'Screw Dheela' not shelved, shoot to commence in 2023: Makers
399.article_body: The makers of Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Screw Dheela' have issued a statement refuting reports that claimed that the film has been shelved due to budget issues and average response to the film's announcement video. The statement shared by the makers clarified that the film has been delayed due to date issues. 'Screw Dheela' will go on floors in 2023, it said.

400.title: Manipur minor allegedly raped by father succumbs after suicide bid
400.article_body: A 15-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her father several times since 2016 and attempted suicide by consuming poison died of multiple organ failure in a hospital in Manipur's capital Imphal on Sunday. The victim had allegedly consumed pesticide on July 31 and was hospitalised on August 3. The accused is currently under judicial custody.

401.title: Ananya gives acting tips to Shanaya & Suhana: Actress' mom Bhavana
401.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday's mother Bhavana Pandey has said her daughter gives acting tips to her friends Shanaya Kapoor and Suhana Khan. "Ananya has a lot of learning to do still but whatever she has learned...she's sharing...with Shanaya and Suhana," Bhavana added. Shanaya will make her debut with 'Bedhadak' while Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies' will mark Suhana's acting debut.

402.title: Congress' internal condition is in shambles: Scindia on Sharma's exit
402.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday joined the discussion around Congress leader Anand Sharma's exit as the Chairman of the Steering Committee for Himachal polls and said that Congress' internal condition is in shambles. Sharma, while tendering his resignation, said that he had no choice but to resign "due to continuous insults and exclusion".

403.title: Siddaramaiah ate meat before visiting temple, it's an insult: BJP
403.article_body: BJP leaders in Karnataka have criticised Congress leader Siddaramaiah for reportedly going to a temple after eating non-vegetarian food and have accused him of hurting religious sentiments. "Siddaramaiah or anyone should not hurt the feelings of the faithful. If you (Siddaramaiah) have guts, eat pork and visit a mosque," said BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal.

404.title: 15 Chinese nationals illegally staying in India detained in UP
404.article_body: Fifteen Chinese nationals staying without valid visas in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district were detained by police on Monday. "They are being sent to a detention centre in Delhi and will be subsequently deported to their country," police said in a statement. This comes after a Chinese national, who was staying illegally in Greater Noida, was arrested in June.
